hypothesis: Heat sources near boundaries behave differently due to BCs. Initializing away from boundaries may improve convergence.
conclusion: ABORTED - Data analysis shows boundary sources exist, biasing away would hurt
rationale_for_abort: Data analysis: 23.8% (19/80) samples have hottest sensor near boundary (within 10% margin)
Hottest sensor is proxy for source location. Boundary sources EXIST in test data.
Abort criteria met: 'Boundary constraint hurts cases with actual boundary sources'
Biasing initialization AWAY from boundaries would hurt these 19 samples
EXP_PHYSICS_INIT_001 already showed initialization modifications don't help (FAILED)
Initialization family marked EXHAUSTED - smart init (hottest sensor) is optimal
key_finding: 24% of samples have evidence of boundary sources. Biasing away would hurt accuracy. Initialization family is EXHAUSTED.
